p.k: Michel Legrand Orchestra at Spa, 1982 1982. Michel Legrand. Spa, Belgium
p.d: Known outside jazz circles mainly for his film scores, French composer, arranger and pianist Michel Legrand has had a long and storied career in music. Interpreters of his compositions include jazz legends such as Sarah Vaughan, Stan Getz, and Bill Evans, as well as pop stars such as Barbra Streisand and Frank Sinatra. During this 1982 performance in the Belgian town of Spa, Legrand leads his orchestra through a number of original songs, including "The Summer Knows," "What Are You Doing the Rest of Your Life?" and "Les Moulins de mon Coeur." Singing either in English or French, Legrand delivers a spirited performance with plenty of romantic flair that is sure to capture your heart.
